name: useActiveListings
summary: Get all active listings

examples.javascript: const { data: listings, isLoading, error } = useActiveListings(contract, { seller: "{{wallet_adress}}", tokenContract: "0x...", tokenId: 1, start: 0, count: 100 });

name: useAddress
summary:
Hook for accessing the address of the connected wallet
```javascript
import { useAddress } from "@thirdweb-dev/react"
```

name: useBuyNow
summary: Buy out an auction listing

name: useCancelListing
summary: Cancel a listing

name: useChainId
summary:
Hook for accessing the chain ID of the network the current wallet is connected to
```javascript
import { useChainId } from "@thirdweb-dev/react"
```

name: useContract
summary: Use this resolve a contract address to a smart contract instance.

examples.javascript: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}");

name: useContract
summary: Use this resolve a contract address to a smart contract instance.

examples.javascript: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}", "nft-drop");

name: useContract
summary: Use this resolve a contract address to a smart contract instance.

examples.javascript: const { contract, isLoading, error } = useContract("{{contract_address}}", ABI);

name: useContractEvents
summary: Get or subscribe to contract events

examples.javascript: const { data: contractEvents, isLoading } = useContractEvents(contract);

name: useContractRead
summary: Get data from a contract read-function call

examples.javascript:
const { contract } = useContract("{{contract_address}}");
const { data, isLoading, error } = useContractRead(contract, "functionName", ...args);

name: useContractWrite
summary: Mke a write call to your contract

name: useEdition
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `Edition` contract. This contract is used to interface with ERC1155 compliant NFTs.

name: useEditionDrop
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `EditionDrop` contract. This conract is used to interface with ERC1155 compliant NFTs that can be lazily minted.

name: useExecuteAuctionSale
summary: Execute an auction sale. Can only be executed once the auction has ended and the auction has a winning bid.

name: useListing
summary: Get a listing

examples.javascript:
const listingId = 0; // the listing id to check
const { data: listing, isLoading, error } = useListing(contract, listingId);

name: useListings
summary: Get all listings

examples.javascript: const { data: listings, isLoading, error } = useListings(contract, { start: 0, count: 100 });

name: useListingsCount
summary: Get the total count of listings

examples.javascript: const { data: listingsCount, isLoading, error } = useListingsCount(contract);

name: useMakeBid
summary: Make a bid on an auction listing

name: useMakeOffer
summary: Nake an offer on a direct or auction listing

name: useMarketplace
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Marketplace` contract. This contract is used to support marketplace for purchase and sale of on-chain assets.

name: useMetadata
summary: Get the metadata of this contract

examples.javascript: const { data: metadata, isLoading, error } = useMetadata(contract);

name: useMultiwrap
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `Multiwrap` contract. This contract is an ERC721 in which you can wrap ERC721, ERC1155 and ERC20 tokens.

name: useNetworkMismatch
summary:
Hook for checking whether the connected wallet is on the correct network specified by the `network` passed to the `<ThirdwebProvider />`.
```javascript
import { useNetworkMistmatch } from "@thirdweb-dev/react"
```

name: useNFTCollection
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `NFTCollection` contract. This contract is meant to interface with ERC721 compliant NFTs.

name: useNFTDrop
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `NFTDrop` contract. This contract is meant to interface with ERC721 compliant NFTs that can be lazily minted.

name: useOffers
summary: Get all the offers for a listing
remarks: Fetch all the offers for a specified direct or auction listing.

examples.javascript:
const listingId = 0;
const { data: offers, isLoading, error } = useOffers(contract, listingId);

name: usePack
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Pack` contract. This contract supports the creation of on-chain luck-based lootboxes.

examples.javascript: const sdk = useSDK();

name: useSignatureDrop
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `SignatureDrop` contract. This contract is meant to interface with ERC721 compliant NFTs that can be lazily minted.

name: useSplit
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Split` contract. This contract supports fund distribution to multiple parties.

name: useStorageUpload
summary: Hook used to upload any files or JSON data to decentralized storage systems like IPFS, using the `storageInterface` configured on the `ThirdwebProvider`

name: useToken
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Token` contract. This contract supports ERC20 compliant tokens.

name: useTokenDrop
summary: Hook for getting an instance of a `Token Drop` contract.

name: useVote
summary: Hook for getting an instance of an `Vote` contract. This contract enables fully featured voting-based decentralized governance systems.

name: useWinningBid
summary: Get the winning bid for an auction

examples.javascript:
const listingId = 0;
const { data: winningBid, isLoading, error } = useWinningBid(contract, listingId);

DirectListing.name: useAcceptDirectListingOffer
DirectListing.summary: Accept an offer on a direct listing from an offeror, will accept the latest offer by the given offeror.

examples.javascript:
const listingId = 0; // the listing id to check
const { data: directListing, isLoading, error } = useListing(contract, listingId);
const { data: directListings, isLoading, error } = useDirectListings(contract, { start: 0, count: 100 });

DirectListing.name: useDirectListingsCount
DirectListing.summary: Get the total count of direct listings

examples.javascript: const { data: directListingsCount, isLoading, error } = useDirectListingsCount(contract);
const { data: validDirectListings, isLoading, error } = useValidDirectListings(contract, { start: 0, count: 100 });
const { data: activeClaimCondition, isLoading, error } = useActiveClaimCondition(contract);

const { data: claimerProofs, isLoading, error } = useClaimerProofs(contract);
